page.title: About re-frame
page.subtitle: Our mission is to make cognitive reframing accessible to everyone with social anxiety

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: re-frame.social was created to provide a safe, supportive space for people with Avoidant Personality Disorder (AvPD) and social anxiety to practice cognitive reframing techniques. We believe everyone deserves access to mental health tools that can help them build confidence and challenge negative thought patterns.

privacy.title: Privacy First
privacy.description: We don't store personal information or track your thoughts. Your privacy is paramount.

evidence.title: Evidence-Based
evidence.description: Our techniques are grounded in proven therapeutic approaches like CBT, DBT, and ACT.

accessible.title: Accessible to All
accessible.description: Free to use, with a simple interface designed for those who may feel overwhelmed by complex apps.

respectful.title: Respectful & Gentle
respectful.description: We understand the courage it takes to challenge your thoughts. Our responses are always supportive.

story.title: Why We Built This
story.content: We understand the daily challenges of living with AvPD and social anxiety. The fear of judgment, the overwhelming self-criticism, the missed opportunities due to avoidance - we know how isolating it can feel. That's why we created re-frame: to offer a judgment-free space where you can practice seeing situations differently, at your own pace, without pressure.

team.title: Built with Care
team.content: re-frame is developed by a team that includes mental health advocates, therapists, and individuals with lived experience of social anxiety. We're committed to creating tools that truly help.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to You
list: Your thoughts are never stored or shared
No accounts or personal information required
Continuously improved based on user feedback

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.content: We'd love to hear from you. Whether you have feedback, suggestions, or just want to share your experience, please reach out.
